column1: Phanat Nikhom (Thai: พนัสนิคม
column2: pronounced [pʰā.nát ní(ʔ).kʰōm]) is a district (amphoe) in the northern part of Chonburi Province

column1: Phanat Nikhom is an ancient city dating back to Dvaravati period
column2: called Mueang Phra Rot. Archaeologists found a fortress and city walls within the district area. In the Rattanakosin era
column5: called Mueang Phanat Nikhom in 1828. It was changed to be a district of Mueang Chon Buri by King Chulalongkorn
column6: Rama V in 1904. Phanat Nikhom was divided into new five districts: Phan Thong
column11: Nong Bon Daeng sub-district in Ban Bueng.

column2: there is a shrine to the Twelve Sisters with the rock they used as pillow when they wandered in the wilderness
column3: as well as a Carissa carandas tree related to the legend.

column6: Ban Pho and Plaeng Yao of Chachoengsao Province).

column1: The district is divided into 20 sub-districts (tambons)
column2: which are further subdivided into 185 villages (mubans). The town (thesaban mueang) Phanat Nikhom covers the whole tambon Phanat Nikhom. Each of the other 19 tambons is led by a tambon administrative organization (TAO).

column1: Missing numbers are tambon which now form Ko Chan District.
